intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. dichtlianum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with flowering stems that bear yellow composite flowers. Its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, with both ray and disk florets. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
